row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Constant-quality drug prices

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.6 percent after increasing 1.7 percent in the second quarter. Imports slowed. Inventory investment and consumer spending picked up. Residential investment turned down.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Third Quarter of 2010
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: Annual Industry Accounts: Revised Statistics for 2007–2009
row.Author: Tameka R. L. Harris, William A. Jolliff, Amanda S. Lyndaker, Matthew B. Schroeder
row.Description: In 2009, 16 of 22 major industry groups contributed to the 2.6 percent decrease in real GDP; durable-goods manufacturing and professional, scientific, and technical services turned down, and construction continued to contract.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Third Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit increased $4.0 billion to $127.2 billion. The surplus on income decreased, and the deficit on goods increased. In the financial account, net financial inflows increased $150.7 billion to $181.6 billion.

row.Title: An Ownership-Based Framework of the U.S. Current Account for 1999–2009
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: An annual supplement to the international accounts presents current-account statistics that combine cross-border trade and net receipts of affiliates of multinational companies.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: In the third quarter of 2010, state personal income slowed in 41 states, picked up in 6 states, and was unchanged in 3 states. Compensation decreased in two-thirds of the 3,113 counties in 2009.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Cyclical economic indicators

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.2 percent after increasing 2.6 percent in the third quarter. Imports turned down, consumer spending picked up, and residential investment turned up. In 2010, real GDP increased 2.9 percent after decreasing 2.6 percent in 2009.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Offshoring and Import Price Measurement: Selected Research From the Conference on "Measurement Issues Arising From the Growth of Globalization"
row.Author: Susan N. Houseman
row.Description: A summary of selected research from this conference.

row.Title: Technological Progress in the Microprocessor Industry
row.Author: Unni Pillai
row.Description: A review of the literature on microprocessor research by a 2010 ASA/NSF/BEA research fellow suggests that accelerating progress in the microprocessor industry played a role in the pickup of aggregate productivity.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Airline price strategies

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 2.8 percent after increasing 2.6 percent in the third quarter. Imports turned down, consumer spending picked up, residential investment turned up, and exports accelerated.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: NIPA Translation of the Fiscal Year 2012 Federal Budget
row.Author: Mark S. Ludwick, Andrea L. Cook
row.Description: Every year, BEA prepares federal government estimates that are based on the proposed budget of the U.S. government. This analysis is often used to gauge the effect of the federal budget on U.S economic activity.
row.Category: National, NIPA translation of the federal budget

row.Title: Comparing NIPA Profits With S&P 500 Profits
row.Author: Andrew W. Hodge
row.Description: Corporate profits measures from BEA's national economic accounts are compared with S&P 500 profits measures.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by Metropolitan Area: Advance Statistics for 2009 and Revised Statistics for 2001–2008
row.Author: Sharon D. Panek, Frank T. Baumgardner, Yolanda B. Langford, Ralph M. Rodriguez
row.Description: Real GDP contracted in 292 of the nation's 366 metropolitan areas in 2009, reflecting decreases in durable-goods manufacturing, construction, and professional and business services. In 2008, real GDP contracted in 200 areas.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by metropolitan area

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Travel spending, Web FAQ service

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Fourth Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 3.1 percent after increasing 2.6 percent in the third quarter. Imports turned down, consumer spending picked up, residential investment turned up, and exports accelerated.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures for the Fourth Quarter of 2010
row.Author: Raymen Labella
row.Description: Net government saving fell $0.8 billion to –$1,294.8 billion. Net federal government saving rose $9.0 billion to –$1,334.4 billion. Net state and local government saving fell $8.1 billion to $39.6 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2010
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Fourth Quarter of 2010 and for 2010
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott, Alexis N. Chaves
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit decreased $12.1 billion to $113.3 billion, reflecting a decrease in the deficit on goods and an increase in the surplus on services. Net financial inflows decreased. In 2010, the current-account deficit increased to $470.2 billion.

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: State personal income for the nation averaged 0.9 percent growth in the fourth quarter of 2010. Growth ranged from 0.5 percent in Maine to 2.3 percent in South Dakota. In 2010, state personal income for the nation averaged 3.0 percent growth

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: MNC activity, Web FAQs

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the First Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.8 percent after increasing 3.1 percent in the fourth quarter of 2010. Imports turned up, consumer spending and nonresidential investment slowed, and federal government spending decreased more.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: Preview of the Upcoming Annual NIPA Revision

row.Title: Annual Industry Accounts: Advance Statistics on GDP by Industry for 2010
row.Author: Teresa L. Gilmore, Edward T. Morgan, Sarah B. Osborne
row.Description: Economic growth turned up in 2010, reflecting widespread recovery across industries. The largest contributors to the upturn were durable-goods manufacturing and retail trade.

row.Title: Modernizing and Enhancing BEA's International Economic Accounts: A Progress Report
row.Author: Kristy L. Howell, Ned G. Howenstine
row.Description: A look at BEA's efforts to modernize these accounts to better align them with updated international guidelines.

row.Title: Local Area Personal Income for 2009
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income declined in 1,740 counties, grew in 1,312 counties, and was unchanged in 58 counties in 2009. Growth ranged from 189 percent in Slope County, ND, to –46 percent in Sully County, SD.

row.Title: Regional Price Parities by Expenditure Class for 2005–2009
row.Author: Bettina H. Aten, Eric B. Figueroa, Troy M. Martin
row.Description: An update on BEA's development of regional price parities, which show price level differences across geographic areas and expenditure classes. These parities were used to adjust regional per capita personal income measures for 2005–2009.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: NIPA annual revision, modernizing international accounts

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the First Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.8 percent after increasing 3.1 percent in the fourth quarter of 2010. Imports turned up, consumer spending and nonresidential investment slowed, and federal government spending decreased more.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: First Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Raymen Labella
row.Description: Net government saving rose $17.6 billion to –$1,282.5 billion. Net federal government saving rose $51.3 billion to –$1,288.4 billion. Net state and local government saving fell $33.6 billion to $6.0 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Trends in Consumer Spending and Personal Saving, 1959–2009
row.Author: Clinton P. McCully
row.Description: A long-term look at consumer spending—including the growth in the share of consumer spending accounted for by services and trends during recessions—and personal saving.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Returns for Domestic Nonfinancial Business
row.Author: Andrew W. Hodge, Robert J. Corea, James M. Green, Bonnie A. Retus
row.Description: Aggregate rates of return for nonfinancial corporations, industries, and selected industry groups and various Q ratios. Domestic nonfinancial corporate returns rose in 2010 after declining in the preceding 3 years.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Travel and Tourism Satellite Accounts for 2007–2010
row.Author: Steven L. Zemanek
row.Description: In 2010, the travel and tourism industry grew 3.1 percent after decreasing 9.3 percent in 2009. Tourism employment continued to decline, but at a slower rate.
row.Category: Industry, Travel and tourism satellite accounts

row.Title: Artistic Originals as Capital Assets
row.Author: Rachel H. Soloveichik
row.Description: As part of the 2013 comprehensive revision of the national accounts, BEA is planning to change its approach to the production of artistic originals by treating such production as investment. A look at how this change might affect GDP and other measures.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Web site upgrades, economy at a glance

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the First Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 1.9 percent after rising 3.1 percent in the fourth quarter of 2010. Imports turned up, consumer spending and nonresidential investment slowed, and federal government spending decreased more.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the First Quarter of 2011
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: Revisions to GDP, GDI, and Their Major Components
row.Author: Dennis J. Fixler, Ryan Greenaway-McGrevy, Bruce T. Grimm
row.Description: This analysis confirms that BEA's estimates provide an accurate picture of the economy, indicating among other things whether growth was positive or negative and whether it was accelerating or decelerating.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Prototype Quarterly Statistics on Gross Domestic Product by Industry
row.Author: Nicole M. Mayerhauser, Erich H. Strassner
row.Description: The second in a series of articles about BEA's plans to regularly release quarterly GDP by industry statistics. This article takes a look at the statistics for 2007–2009 and describes the methodology.

row.Title: The International Investment Position of the United States at Yearend 2010
row.Author: Elena L. Nguyen
row.Description: The net international investment position was –$2,471.0 billion; in 2009, it was –$2,396.4 billion. U.S.-owned assets abroad increased $1,828.3 billion to $20,315.4 billion, and foreign-owned assets in the United States increased $1,902.9 billion to $22,786.3 billion.

row.Title: Direct Investment Positions for 2010: Country and Industry Detail
row.Author: Kevin B. Barefoot, Marilyn Ibarra-Caton
row.Description: U.S. direct investment abroad grew 10 percent after growing 10 percent in 2009. Foreign direct investment in the United States grew 11 percent after growing 3 percent in 2009.

row.Title: Annual Revision of the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Author: Mai-Chi Hoang, Erin M. Whitaker
row.Description: Each year, statistics on U.S. international transactions are revised to incorporate revised data and statistical improvements. Several changes were introduced this year to align the accounts with the updated international guidelines.

row.Title: How BEA Aligns and Augments Source Data From the U.S. Treasury Department for Inclusion in the U.S. International Transactions Accounts
row.Description: Each year, the estimates of financial-account flows, which are based on Treasury Department data, are adjusted to align the estimates with balance-of-payments concepts and to close the gaps in coverage.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions: First Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit increased $7.1 billion to $119.3 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows increased $152.5 billion to $181.9 billion.

row.Title: International Transactions and Positions in Financial Derivatives
row.Description: Statistics on transactions in financial derivatives by type of contract and by area and country for 2008–2010. Statistics on the fair values of these derivatives for 2009–2010.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by State: Advance Statistics for 2010 and Revised Statistics for 2007–2009
row.Author: Jonathan E. Avery, Todd P. Siebeneck, Robert P. Tate
row.Description: The economic recovery was widespread in 2010, as real GDP increased in 48 states and the District of Columbia. In 2009, real GDP decreased in 40 states and the District of Columbia.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by state

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income in all states increased in the first quarter of 2011. Growth ranged from 0.7 percent in Iowa to 6.9 percent in North Dakota.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: OAS survey, updated ITA concepts and methods

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP increased 1.3 percent after increasing 0.4 percent in the first quarter. Imports slowed, federal government spending turned up, and business investment picked up. Consumer spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Annual Revision of the National Income and Product Accounts: Annual Estimates for 2003–2010 and Quarterly Estimates for 2003:I—2011:I
row.Author: Eugene P. Seskin, Shelly Smith
row.Description: Details of the 2011 annual revision, which incorporated newly available source data, new methodologies, and new presentations.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: National Income and Product Accounts Tables
row.Description: Annual, quarterly, and monthly statistics from the annual NIPA revision, including advance estimates for the second quarter of 2011 and preliminary estimates for June 2011.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)
row.Supp1_Title: Summary National Income and Product Accounts

row.Title: GDP and Other Major NIPA Series for 1929–2011:II
row.Description: Historical statistics on GDP and its components in current dollars, chained dollars, and chain-type quantity and price indexes, including statistics on national income and personal income.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: U.S. Affiliates of Foreign Companies: Operations in 2009
row.Author: Thomas Anderson
row.Description: The current-dollar value added of these affiliates decreased 9.1 percent to $587.9 billion. Employment by these affiliates fell 6.3 percent.
row.Category: International, Foreign direct investment in the United States

rows.row: SCB-91-09-01 91 9 September 2011 Director's Message J. Steven Landefeld Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld http://bea.gov/scb/pdf/2011/09%20September/0911_directmsg.pdf Director's Message `2011-09-16`

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA Twitter, updated fixed assets, updated FAQs

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 1.0 percent after rising 0.4 percent in the first quarter. Imports slowed, federal government spending turned up, and business investment picked up. Consumer spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Second Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Raymen Labella
row.Description: Net government saving decreased $54.7 billion to –$1,313.0 billion. Net federal government saving decreased $63.3 billion to –$1,264.4 billion. Net state and local government saving increased $8.6 billion to –$48.6 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Analyzing Federal Programs Using BEA Statistics: A Look at Unemployment Insurance Benefits Payments
row.Author: Mark S. Ludwick, Benjamin A. Mandel
row.Description: A look at the effects of recent federal legislation designed to stabilize and stimulate the economy on the national income and product accounts.

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: Statistics on government spending by function, changes in the net stock of fixed assets, and a comparison of NIPA and USDA net farm income. All reflect the 2011 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Fixed Assets and Consumer Durable Goods for 1997–2010
row.Author: Jennifer A. Bennett, Michael D. Glenn, David B. Wasshausen, Mark Bailey, Michael T. Cusick, Michael D. Glenn, Mark A. Ledbetter, Christopher B. Mbu, Nadia F.P. Sadée
row.Description: Statistics on the net stock of (1) equipment and software and of business and government structures and (2) consumer durable goods. Both reflect the 2011 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Fixed assets and consumer durable goods

row.Title: GDP for American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, and the U.S. Virgin Islands for 2002–2009
row.Author: Aya Hamano
row.Description: The economies of American Samoa, the CNMI, and the U.S. Virgin Islands each contracted in both 2008 and 2009, while Guam's economy grew modestly in both years.

row.Title: Direct Investment for 2007–2010: Detailed Historical-Cost Positions and Related Financial and Income Flows
row.Author: Jeffrey H. Lowe
row.Description: Statistics on (1) the direct investment positions and international transactions of U.S. and foreign multinational companies and (2) the composition of investment by U.S. companies abroad and foreign companies in the United States.
row.Supp2_Title: Foreign Direct Investment in the United States Tables

row.Title: Personal Income for Metropolitan Areas for 2010
row.Author: David G. Lenze
row.Description: Personal income increased in all but 4 of the nation's 366 metropolitan areas. In the metropolitan portion of the United States, it rose 2.9 percent after falling 1.9 percent in 2009.
row.Category: Regional, Personal income for metropolitan areas

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Government tables, travel spending

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Third Estimates for the Second Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 1.3 percent after rising 0.4 percent in the first quarter. Imports slowed, federal government spending turned up, and business investment picked up. Consumer spending slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: Statistics on federal receipts and expenditures and the budget, state government and local government receipts and expenditures, and seasonally unadjusted estimates. All reflect the 2011 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Real Inventories, Sales, and Inventory-Sales Ratios for Manufacturing and Trade for the Fourth Quarter of 2007 to the Second Quarter of 2011
row.Description: Updated statistics, including statistics on inventories for manufacturing by stage of fabrication. All reflect the 2011 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, Inventories, sales, and inventory-sales ratios for manufacturing and trade

row.Title: U.S. International Services: Cross-Border Trade in 2010 and Services Supplied Through Affiliates in 2009
row.Author: Jennifer Koncz-Bruner, Anne Flatness
row.Description: A broad look at international services provided to and by the United States in two channels.

row.Title: U.S. International Transactions for the Second Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Sarah P. Scott
row.Description: The U.S. current-account deficit decreased $1.6 billion to $118.0 billion. In the financial account, net financial inflows decreased $130.3 billion to $25.7 billion.

row.Title: Gross Domestic Product by Metropolitan Area for 2007–2010
row.Author: Sharon D. Panek, Slavea A. Assenova, Jake R. Hinson, Ralph M. Rodriguez
row.Description: Real GDP grew in 304 of the nation's 366 metropolitan areas in 2010, reflecting growth in durable-goods manufacturing, trade, and financial activities. In 2009, real GDP decreased in 296 areas.
row.Category: Regional, Gross domestic product by metropolitan area

row.Title: Regional Quarterly Report
row.Author: David G. Lenze, Tina C. Highfill, Ann E. Dunbar
row.Description: In the second quarter of 2011, state personal income growth ranged from 2.2 percent in Nebraska and South Dakota to 0.7 percent in Washington state and Georgia.

row.Title: Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: BEA–BLS international data linked, BEA Twitter accounts

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Advance Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.5 percent after rising 1.3 percent in the second quarter. Consumer spending and nonresidential investment picked up. State and local government spending decreased less.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Newly Available NIPA Tables
row.Description: State and local government receipts and expenditures and Census Bureau data, personal income and its disposition by households and nonprofit institutions serving households, and BEA and IRS statistics on income and outlays by these nonprofits.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Updated Summary of NIPA Methodologies
row.Description: The data and methods used to prepare current-dollar and real estimates of GDP and current-dollar estimates of gross domestic income, reflecting the 2011 annual NIPA revision.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Operations of U.S. Multinational Companies in the United States and Abroad Preliminary Results From the 2009 Benchmark Survey
row.Author: Kevin B. Barefoot, Raymond J. Mataloni Jr.
row.Description: A look at the operations of U.S. multinational companies in the first decade of the 21st century, with a focus on value added, employment, R&D, and other topics.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2012
Director's Message
row.Author: J. Steven Landefeld
row.Description: Monthly message from BEA Director Steve Landefeld

row.Title: Taking Account
row.Description: Direct investment data, BEA alerts

row.Title: GDP and the Economy: Second Estimates for the Third Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Christopher Swann
row.Description: Real GDP rose 2.0 percent after rising 1.3 percent in the second quarter. Consumer spending and nonresidential investment picked up. State and local government spending decreased less. Corporate profits slowed.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Government Receipts and Expenditures: Third Quarter of 2011
row.Author: Stan J. Bellotti
row.Description: Net government saving increased $64.6 billion to –$1,251.0 billion. Net federal government saving increased $102.6 billion to –$1,172.8 billion. Net state and local government saving decreased $38.0 billion to $78.2 billion.
row.Category: National, National income and product accounts (NIPAs)

row.Title: Annual Industry Accounts: Revised Statistics for 2003–2010
row.Author: Teresa L. Gilmore, Amanda S. Lyndaker, Sarah J. Pack, Simon N. Randrianarivel
row.Description: Real GDP by industry grew 3.0 percent in 2010 after decreasing 3.5 percent in 2009. In 2010, 16 of 22 major industry groups contributed to the growth.

row.Title: Subject Guide
row.Description: A list of articles published in the Survey of Current Business in 2011.

row.Title: Schedule of BEA News Releases in 2012
